isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 5000 9100 9200 9400 9900 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 5000, 5000i, 9000, 9000i - DIAGNOSTICS - SENSOR FAULT DIAGNOSTICS

svcprocinfo.para: With electronic or mechanical engines, electronic gauge sensor faults are reported by steering the gauge pointer to the 6 o'clock position and the alarm sounding three long beeps.

svcsubproc.title: With Electronic Engines
svcsubproc.para: The related gauge will go to the 6 o'clock position and the alarm will sound three long beeps based on diagnostic messages from the International, Caterpillar, Cummins or Detroit Diesel ECM. The software capabilities of these manufacturers are not the same, so not all defects will be reported. The EZ-Tech or Pro-Link 9000 EST can be used to check for engine fault codes that relate to sensor defects.

Additionally, the EZ-Tech or Pro-Link 9000 EST can be used to monitor engine oil pressure, water temperature, vehicle speed and engine rpm from data link connector (137). This is the same signal sent to the Speedometer/Tachometer module, only accessed at a different connector.

An open fuel sender or open fuel sender circuit (ground or signal circuit) will cause three long beeps and the gauge will go to 6 o'clock. Note that a shorted fuel sender or sender circuit would cause the gauge to read empty all of the time.

svcsubproc.title: With Mechanical Engines
svcsubproc.para: Not all fault conditions will be reported due to sensor characteristics. The related gauge will go to the 6 o'clock position and the alarm will sound three long beeps for:

step1.para: An open fuel sender or open fuel sender circuit (ground or signal circuit). Note that a shorted fuel sender or sender circuit would cause the gauge to read empty all of the time.
An open or short in the oil pressure sensor or any of the three circuits connecting it to the Speedometer/Tachometer module.
A shorted water temperature sender or circuit. Note that an open condition would cause a very low false reading.
